title.rendered: What’s the difference between a Tax Lien and Levy?

content.rendered: If you’ve received a notice from the IRS, you could be at risk of having IRS action taken against you. Some of the most common tactics that are used by the IRS is filing a tax lien or levying an individual’s assets. Optima CEO David King and Lead Tax Attorney Philip Hwang help taxpayers understand the difference between a lien and levy and how to stay on the IRS’ good side.
